intro: Sisymbrium strictum, commonly known as narrowleaf wild radish, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from May to July. Its fruit is a slender, cylindrical pod that splits open to release seeds. Sisymbrium strictum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open fields.
